intro: Hibbertia polystachya, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and is well adapted to the dry conditions of its natural habitat. Hibbertia polystachya is known for its showy, clustered inflorescences that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in gardens across Australia.
